title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 4033.3 - Items weighed with jockey
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 4033.3 - Items weighed with jockey

State Regulations

Every jockey shall be weighed with the clothing that
such jockey will wear in the race. No whip or substitute for a whip, blinkers
or number cloth shall be allowed on the scales, nor shall any bridle, muzzle, martingale, breastplate, safety vest or safety helmet approved by the stewards
be weighed. A safety vest shall meet the requirements of section
4006.8
of this

Article. Notes

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
